title: Monthly Parking Passes vs. Hourly Rates: Finding Your Revenue Mix
description: Learn how to balance monthly parking passes and hourly rates to maximize revenue. Pricing strategies, capacity management, and when each model works best for your lot.
excerpt: Most parking lot owners think they need to choose between monthly passes and hourly rates. That binary thinking leaves money on the table. The best revenue strategy uses both.
imageAlt: Parking lot owner comparing monthly pass and hourly rate pricing strategies.
author: Monetize Parking

title: Parking Revenue Analytics: The Metrics That Actually Matter
description: Stop tracking vanity metrics. Learn which parking analytics actually drive revenue decisions: utilization rates, compliance patterns, peak demand timing, and warning signs.
excerpt: Total monthly revenue tells you almost nothing about how well your parking operation actually performs. The right metrics reveal pricing opportunities, operational problems, and capacity issues before they cost you money.

author: Monetize Parking

title: Mixed-Use Development Parking: Balancing Multiple Tenant Needs
description: Learn how to monetize parking in mixed-use developments with retail, residential, and office tenants. Time-sharing strategies, validation programs, and revenue allocation models.
excerpt: Mixed-use developments create parking revenue opportunities that single-use properties cannot match. The same spaces serve office workers during weekdays, retail customers on weekends, and residential visitors in evenings.
imageAlt: Mixed-use development with retail, office, and residential tenants sharing parking facilities.
author: Monetize Parking

title: Brewery and Bar Parking: Late-Night Revenue Without Liability Issues

author: Monetize Parking

title: How Airport Proximity Parking Lots Capture Long-Term Traveler Revenue
